title: France prepares for unpredictable municipal elections, one year before presidential vote
subhead: Local officials fear the national political crisis will have a ripple effect on the upcoming municipal elections in March. Three-way and four-way runoffs are expected to be widespread, paving the way for political realignments just months before the crucial 2027 presidential contest.

title: Putin and US envoy Witkoff begin talks in Moscow
Zelensky blasts EU at Davos, claims US security guarantees for Ukraine are ready
Iranians in Turkey flee repression and bear witness to the bloodshed in their country
subhead: The brutal response of the Iranian regime against protesters has led many Iranians to seek refuge in neighboring Turkey. Their stories attest to the cruelty that the authorities have shown since the beginning of the protest movement.

title: Tenants are less well-housed than homeowners, says latest INSEE report
subhead: The 2024 housing conditions survey shows that the proportion of homeowner households (57%) and tenant households (40%) has changed little over the past decade. The latter are more exposed to overcrowding and housing defects.

title: French say they love art, but rarely visit exhibitions
subhead: An Ipsos-BVA survey for Beaux Arts Magazine, released on Thursday, reveals the public's taste for contemporary art but a limited knowledge of living artists.

title: Dior and Vuitton: The question of innovation at Paris men's fashion week
subhead: For the fall-winter 2026-2027 menswear collections, presented in Paris through January 25, Pharrell Williams designed an everyday wardrobe at Vuitton, while Jonathan Anderson offered a new vision for Dior menswear.

Who are Greenlanders and what do they really want?
subhead: Greenland, which is bigger than France, the UK, Germany and Spain combined, has a population of 57,000, most of whom are Inuit. They are also Danish citizens, a legacy of Denmark's colonization of the territory that began in the 18th century.
byline: Arthur Navet ,  Constance Derouin and  Sinead McCausland

title: Cohere's Joëlle Pineau: 'We aim for AI that creates value for businesses, not superintelligence'
subhead: The former number two in artificial intelligence research at Meta left Mark Zuckerberg's group to join the Canadian start-up.

title: Maya Kandel, historian: 'The more Trump uses force, the more confident he becomes'
subhead: Elected on an isolationist promise, the American president has multiplied foreign interventions. This policy risks weakening his MAGA base, the researcher says in an interview with Le Monde.

title: A brief respite in the transatlantic crisis
